s.text: In contrast to trial-blinded Washington, states are using their newly bulging coffers to reform education, health care, and Social Security.

An article says that Mongolia is clogged with a "glut of raw cashmere": Fresh-off-the-goat cashmere fetches a rock-bottom price worldwide, as supply has skyrocketed (thanks to capitalism, the number of goats in Mongolia has doubled since 1992).
Newsweek calculates the bottom line on the president's plan to save Social Security: It promises away a full 151 percent of the projected budget surplus, and would create a shortfall of $2.
An article finds "feminism" in an unexpected place: primitive, forest-dwelling tribes.
